author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 22-year-old woman had allegedly committed suicide by hanging near Pudur village. She was seven months pregnant.

Prabhavathi was married to Pandurangan two-and-a-half-years ago. The couple has a one-and-a-half year old daughter. They were residing at Periya Street in Pudur village.

On Thursday morning, Prabhavathi was found hanging from a tree on an agricultural land.

Police said she committed suicide following a family dispute.

Suspecting foul play in her death, her father, Rajendran, lodged a complaint at the Banavaram police station. He alleged that her in-laws harassed her demanding dowry, police said.

A Revenue Divisional Officer (RDO) inquiry has been ordered in the case, as the woman died within seven years of marriage. RDO of Ranipet will conduct the inquiry.

Persons in need of counselling can contact the State Health Department’s round-the-clock helpline – 104. Chennai-based Sneha suicide prevention centre can be contacted at 044-24640050.

Suspecting foul play, her father lodged a complaint at Banavaram police station
title: Pregnant woman allegedly commits suicide near Pudur
